blocks.subject: RE: Revised 7EA Turbine Letter Agreement
text: My memory has failed me once again!

blocks.subject: RE: Revised 7EA Turbine Letter Agreement
raw_header: Subject: RE: Revised 7EA Turbine Letter Agreement
text: Kay:
My notes indicate that the promissory note structure was used not due to HSR
concerns, but rather, in order to avoid issues associated with
disproportionate distributions resulting from the contribution of funds as
capital.  I believe that the use of an LLC as the subject entity eliminated
the HSR issues.  Of course, the higher HSR threshold is also now effective.
Carolyn M. Campbell
King=01;& Spalding
ccampbell@kslaw.com <mailto:ccampbell@kslaw.com>

blocks.subject: RE: Revised 7EA Turbine Letter Agreement
raw_header: Subject: RE: Revised 7EA Turbine Letter Agreement
text: Carloyn,
Is the promissory note structure still necessary, given the increase in the
HSR threshhold?
ckm

blocks.subject: RE: Revised 7EA Turbine Letter Agreement  Kay:  Yes, the 1/11 draft (v4) is the current draft.  Carolyn M. Campbell King=01;& Spalding 713-276-7307 (phone) 713-751-3280 (fax) ccampbell@kslaw.com <mailto:ccampbell@kslaw.com>
raw_header: Subject:  RE: Revised 7EA Turbine Letter Agreement
Yes, the 1/11 draft (v4) is the current draft.

blocks.subject: Revised 7EA Turbine Letter Agreement   Hi Carolyn,  Is this the most current version?  Thanks,  Kay

blocks.subject: Revised 7EA Turbine Letter Agreement
text: Kay:
We have enclosed clean and marked copies of a revised draft of the 7EA
turbine letter agreement reflecting revisions from the draft previously
distributed on January 8, 2001.  Please review and advise of any comments.
Thank you.
Carolyn M. Campbell
King & Spalding
ccampbell@kslaw.com
